meanings.definition: The quality or state of being textual.
meanings.sent1: The textuality of the book made it easy to understand.
meanings.sent2: She appreciated the textuality of the article, as it helped her research.
meanings.sent3: The textuality of the menu made her laugh, as it was full of spelling mistakes.
meanings.sent4: The textuality of the map guided them through the city like a storybook.
meanings.sent5: The textuality of the painting brought out the emotions of the artist.

meanings.definition: The use of written or printed material as a medium of communication.
meanings.sent1: The textuality of the letter conveyed his feelings effectively.
meanings.sent2: She studied the textuality of ancient scrolls to learn about history.
meanings.sent3: The textuality of the sign made her chuckle, as it was written in a funny font.
meanings.sent4: The textuality of the newspaper spoke volumes about the current events.
meanings.sent5: The textuality of the flyer caught her attention with its bold font.
